"1. The first tab is meant for individual calculations. If you need to make a mark calculation but not save it, this is where it is done. 2. Click setting in the menu. This is where you need to presave the information of the weights of the catagories for each class. 3. The third tab is for saving your marks. You need to first do step two in order to make use of this feature. Simply select the class you want to add a mark to and the catalog will show you what your average is"

"To add a new mark, press the + button. In the popup, enter a name for the mark (Example: Unit Test 1). Also enter the mark as a fraction, if you have the percent mark, just make the denominator out of 1. Select the catagory that it falls under and also the weight that that mark has. (Example: a test is usually weighted 5) Note: Long click on the mark you want additional access to and proceed from there. The options are to either edit or delete the mark you long click on. The mark in the top corner is to two decimal places for your benefit and the bottom shows your mark in each of the catagories"

Welcome to Mark Calculator. This is an amazing app that will help you keep track of all the marks you have gotten. It is set up using the Ontario grading system which uses the 4 catagoies, Knowledge and Understanding, Making Connections (Application), Thinking and Inquiry, Communication. You can calculate the mark you get on an individual test by factoring in the weighting of the different catagories. This app will render the need for a teacher to provide a Mark Book update useless as this will do it for you. Please read the instructions on how to use this. I am sorry for the ads, but if they are too much of a both I can release a paid version with no ads. If there are any comment or concerns, please feel free to contact me, there is a tab located in the menu to do so. ENJOY!
